info_text: The title of the model
The names of the authors
Contact email address
If a study is associated with the model, then add the title of this study
If a study is associated with the model, then add the link to the study (doi, url)
The target variable the model aims to predict
The scientific field in which the model was developed
Plot of samples
Plot of the training area
Plot of nearest neighbour distances in geographic space (see \url {https://hannameyer.github.io/CAST/reference/geodist.html} for more information)
At what spatial/temporal extent where the samples collected?
How where the samples collected?
The geometry type of the samples (e.g., Polygons of Land-Cover classes, Points of climate stations)
The number of training samples
The number of response classes
The number of samples in each class
The range of response values represented in the training data
The sampling design(will be automatically filled when sampling locations and prediction area are provided as .gpkg)
The coordinate reference system used to reference the samples (epsg code)
The sources of the response data (e.g., own field sampling, biodiversity databes like GBIF etc.)
Type of predictor variables*
suggestions: Remote Sensing Images, Simulated Data, Spatial Proxies

info_text: The number of predictor variables used initially (before predictor selection)
List of all initial predictor variables
Detail on preprocessing steps taken
suggestions: Cloud removal, Normalization, Filtering, Outlier removal

info_text: The sources of predictors (e.g., Worldclim)
Is the learning method developed for Regression or Classification tasks?
Name of the applied learning method
Outline the model's architecture (nodes, layers etc.)
Specify potential biases in the data or algorithmic decision-making
Assessment of the impact of varying input parameters or assumptions on the prediction
Describe limitations in the use of the model
Details on the validation strategy used for model selection
suggestions: Independent probability sample, Random Cross-Validation, Spatial Cross-Validation, Spatio-Temporal Cross-Validation, Target-Oriented Cross-Validation, bootstrap, -

info_text: Which performance metrics were used?
suggestions: RMSE, MAE, Rsquared, adjusted Rsquared, Kappa, Accuracy, Confusion Matrix, AUC

info_text: Results of the validation
Methods for hyperparameter tuning (List tuning range and final value)
Methods for selection of predictors
Methods of explainable AI used to gain insights into the models behaviour
suggestions: SHAP, Permutation Importance, ALE, ICE, PDP, H-statistic

info_text: Discuss the implications of the models results in the context of ecological theory / processes / management decisions
Programming language and versioning of key libraries
Code availability (e.g., Link to Code Repository (such as GitHub))
Data availability (e.g., Link to Data repository (such as Figshare))
plot of prediction area
plot of geodist
Intended (spatial) prediction domain / area (only needed if no prediction area is uploaded)
Details on the evaluation of the prediction
suggestions: Independent probability sample, Random Cross-Validation, Spatial Cross-Validation, Spatio-Temporal Cross-Validation, Target-Oriented Cross-Validation, bootstrap

info_text: Performance metrics used
suggestions: RMSE, MAE, Rsquared, adjusted Rsquared, Kappa, Accuracy, Confusion Matrix, AUC

info_text: Final map accuracy
Details on the uncertainty quantification method
Details on threshold selection, if applicable: transforming continuous predictions into binary predictions
Post-processing, e.g. Filter
